posts.post_content:
I don't think people give this enough credit. Yes, it "dies to removal" even more than your average creature does, but there are plenty of ways to protect it, especially in M11. I drafted one of these in a mono-blue control deck I put together and they couldn't even touch it.  
  
Maybe i'm a bit biased, as this is the first mythic rare I ever opened, and it was shiny, too.

Posted By: Kryptnyt (11/1/2010 6:48:30 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Sure, in serious play, this card blows. It is hard to bring out, easy to remove, and a cheap way to win. But it is fun to use in casual play, let me tell ya.  
I like the ability to use gimick decks with friends, decks that utilize crazy combos and interesting cards for a fun game, and this card is definitely fun. I don't play competitively, and Platinum Angel is not my win condition, but for the moment you bring it out, the room starts laughing, and your friend utters an "aw, f\*\*k..."   
Priceless.
posts.html:

Posted By: BlackAlbino (9/27/2010 6:08:08 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@Daijin26   
  
How does this card remove skill? It takes skill to be able to play this card and keep it alive. Seriously. First off it costs 7! Unless your playing very basic magic right out of a starter box then theres a high chance that you wont be able to play this wonderful temptress at all. The game will probably be over. But if you DO actually have a way to obtain 7 mana then she's open to any doom blade or any other removal which usually costs around 2 mana.  
You pay 7 for a sweet angel  
Opponent pays 2 for a journey to no where  
You're out 5 mana.   
Of coarse there is the chance that the other player doesn't have any removal but each deck (in my person opinion) should have some form of way to have the opponents creatures killed weather its a mana leak, doom blade, path to exile, or even Whirlwind.  
A deck should cover all weaknesses. Even if you don't like removal have a strong creature out like Terra stomper and use lure or something.   
Also I wouldn't want to draw her if it was my fir... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
@Daijin26

How does this card remove skill? It takes skill to be able to play this card and keep it alive. Seriously. First off it costs 7! But if you DO actually have a way to obtain 7 mana then she's open to any doom blade or any other removal which usually costs around 2 mana.
You pay 7 for a sweet angel
Opponent pays 2 for a journey to no where
You're out 5 mana.
Of coarse there is the chance that the other player doesn't have any removal but each deck (in my person opinion) should have some form of way to have the opponents creatures killed weather its a mana leak, doom blade, path to exile, or even Whirlwind.
A deck should cover all weaknesses. Even if you don't like removal have a strong creature out like Terra stomper and use lure or something.
